CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and resides in the town of FAC , GPE region , GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant 's late wife instituted proceedings in the Zhovtovodskyy Town Court of Dnipropetrovsk Region against her employer , a ORG - owned company , ORG ( NORP управління будівництва ) , in order to receive salary arrears and other payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant 's wife and awarded her CARDINAL NORP hryvnas ( “ UAH ” ) ( PERSON міського суду ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Zhovti Vody Town Bailiffs ' Service ( ORG виконавчої служби Жовтоводського міського управління юстиції ) initiated the enforcement proceedings . On DATE the applicant 's wife received UAH CARDINAL . On DATE she received a further ORG CARDINAL . The rest of the awarded amount remains unpaid .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's wife died .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of GPE against ORG , claiming the salary arrears due to his late wife and compensation for moral damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was recognised as an heir of his late wife .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found against the applicant on the ground that the company was an independent legal entity for which debts the Ministry was not responsible .

CARDINAL . NORP By letter of DATE , ORG informed the applicant that the enforcement proceedings had been stayed because of the bankruptcy proceedings initiated against the debtor by a decision of DATE of ORG of the Dnipropetrovsk Region . ORG also stated that , according to the PERSON on the Introduction of a Moratorium on the Forced Sale of Property , on DATE a ban on the forced sale of assets belonging to undertakings in which the ORG holds PERCENT of the share capital had been introduced .
CARDINAL . By the decree of CARDINAL DATE ORG liquidated the debtor company .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
